nodes.name: Filter out row with invalid price
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame containing only rows satisfying given condition
nodes.details:
This node creates a new DataFrame containing only rows satisfying the given condition.

Examples of Conditional Expression


col1 > 5 AND col2 > 3

name is not NULL

name is NULL

usd_pledged_real > 0 and (category = "Narrative Film" or category == "Music") and goal > 100

datetime > '2011-01-01 00:00:00.0' (datetime column is of type timestamp)

datetime > '2011-01-01 00:00:00.0' and datetime < '2016-01-01 00:00:00.0'

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: conditionExpr
fields.title: Conditional Expression
fields.description: The filtering condition. Rows not satisfying given condition will be excluded from output DataFrame. eg: usd_pledged_real > 0 and (category = 1 or category == 2) and goal > 100

nodes.name: Documentation
nodes.description: Allows capturing Notes on the Workflow

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
Complex Customer ETL Workflow


This workflow performs ETL on a fact and number of dimension files.


It cleans the dataset, computes aggregates for reporting and saves the results.


It then joins the fact data with multiple dimensional datasets to form the big table which is saved.



ETL Workflow:


  • There are fact files and reference data files. 
  • Each fact is described on these dimensions: geo, prod, time, customer.
  • Reference files are CSV and have a header line.
  • Fact file is fixed width and has no header line.



Fact file structure


  • geo_id, prod_id, time_id, cust_id, units_sold, price
fields.title: Comment
fields.description: Comments for the Workflow
